item.title: Netanyahu Defends His Plans for Gaza, Amid Outrage in Israel
item.description: After thousands of Israeli workers walked off the job on Monday, angry over the deaths of hostages in Gaza, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said at a news conference that the war would only end when Israel had eliminated Hamas.

item.title: Two U.S. Marines attacked in Turkey by nationalist youth group
item.description: Police detained 15 people after the assault. Video shows assailants shouting “Yankee go home” and covering one Marine’s head in what looked like a white sack.

item.title: More than 100 killed in attempt to escape DRC’s largest prison
item.description:
Democratic Republic of the Congo officials say 129 people died in failed jailbreak at Makala facility in Kinshasa

More than 100 people were killed as they were trying to escape from a prison in the capital of the Democratic Republic of the Congo in the early hours of Monday, the security minister has said.

In a post on X on Tuesday morning, Jacquemain Shabani Lukoo said 129 people had died and 59 others were injured in the escape attempt at Makala prison in Kinshasa. Twenty-four of those who died were killed by gunfire, while the others lost their lives in a crush during the chaos, he said.

Continue reading...

item.title: Sacked Robert Ovadia claims Seven’s ‘propaganda unit’ is seeking to destroy his reputation
item.description:
Veteran reporter denies all accusations of wrongdoing after internal investigation into allegations of ‘inappropriate behaviour’

  • Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates
  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

Sacked Channel Seven reporter Robert Ovadia has described Seven West Media as an “evil company” and claimed its “propaganda unit” is seeking to destroy his reputation.

The veteran journalist was fired in June after Seven conducted an internal investigation into allegations of “inappropriate behaviour”.

Sign up for Guardian Australia’s breaking news email

Continue reading...

item.title: Federal Liberal party to forcibly take over NSW division after ‘scathing’ nominations debacle review
item.description:
Committee will be appointed for 10 months and the NSW Liberals have until next Thursday to comply

The federal Liberal executive has intervened in the NSW party, demanding it appoint a temporary committee of three to run the troubled division after the failure to nominate candidates for some council seats.

On Tuesday the federal executive was briefed on the content of Brian Loughnane’s snap review of the NSW Liberals, which party sources told Guardian Australia was “scathing” about both the nomination failure and the preparedness to fight the federal election.

Continue reading...

item.title: NSW families minister admits child protection system using motels hours after indicating ban
item.description:
Kate Washington tells hearing ‘accredited providers’ will continue with hotel and motel placements for children removed from families

  • Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates
  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

The minister in charge of New South Wales’ troubled child protection system has admitted that vulnerable children will continue to be housed in hotels and motels – just hours after suggesting such emergency accommodation would be banned.

The state’s families minister, Kate Washington, told a parliamentary hearing on Tuesday that “accredited providers” would continue to operate hotel and motel placements for children who had been removed from their families due to abuse or neglect.

Sign up for Guardian Australia’s breaking news email

Continue reading...

item.title: Israel-Gaza war live: Polio vaccination campaign continues in Gaza despite bombardments
item.description:
Israel agreed to limited pauses in fighting to facilitate campaign but airstikes have continued, reports say

My colleagues Malak A Tantesh and Bethan McKernan have this report on the struggles of delivering the huge polio vaccination campaign in Gaza, where much of the healthcare system has been destroyed by Israel during the war:

Like so many in Gaza, Eid al-Attar, a teacher from the north of the territory, now spends his days trying to find enough food and water to keep his family alive. Displaced eight times since the war between Israel and Hamas broke out in October, the 42-year-old has tried his best to shield his five children from the conflict. Now the Palestinian territory is facing a new danger: the highly infectious and potentially deadly disease, polio.

On the day that those beautiful people were being buried, kidnapped from a music festival like Reading or Glastonbury, the UK decides to send a signal that it’s Israel that it wants to penalise, and that is a terrible, terrible message to be sending both to Israel in its hour of need, also to Hamas about the consequences - where consequences are for the horrific actions that Hamas has taken as a terrorist organisation, but also to other allies and adversaries around the world. So it is the wrong decision taken very much at the wrong time.

Continue reading...

Donald Trump's Nephew Drops S-Bomb On MSNBC During Searing Takedown Of Uncle
